Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people put back to work in the United States compared to all other advanced economies combined.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that more people have been put back to work in the United States than in all other advanced economies combined.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the specific people who lost their jobs during the recession in the United States have now been reemployed, which may not be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the difference in employment growth between the United States and other advanced economies, such as differences in population size.
